materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge. 2 st markers.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements:
To fit chest measurement
S 10" [25.5 cm]
M 16" [40.5 cm]
L 24" [61 cm]
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• When working from chart, carry color not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it.
• Change colors by drawing new color through last 2 loops on hook and proceed with new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
Neck Ribbing: With MC and smaller hook, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loop only of each st, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 31 (47-72) times more.
Body: Change to larger hook.
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Work 34 (50-74) sc across long edge of neck ribbing. Turn.
Work Chart I (I-II) in sc (see page 3), reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right, noting side incs on 3rd row and following RS rows 2 (6-10) times more. 40 (64-96) sc.
Note: Work each inc by working 2 sc in indicated st.
Work 3 (1-1) row(s) even from Chart, ending on a WS row.
Row 10 (16-24) of Chart is complete.
Sizes S and M only: Leg Openings: Keeping cont of Chart I, proceed as follows:
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across 5 (8) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Keeping cont of Chart I, work a further 5 (7) rows from Chart. Do not fasten off.
Row 16 (24) of Chart is complete for Right Side.
With RS facing, skip next 4 (7) sc. Rejoin yarn to rem sts. Ch 1. Work pat across 22 (34) sc (Center Section). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Keeping cont of Chart I, work a further 5 (7) rows from Chart. Fasten off.
Row 16 (24) of Chart is complete for Center Section.
With RS facing, skip next 4 (7) sc. Rejoin yarn to rem sts. Ch 1. Work pat across last 5 (8) sc (Left Side). Turn.
Keeping cont of Chart I, work a further 5 (7) rows from Chart. Fasten off.
Row 16 (24) of Chart is complete for Left Side.
Size L only: Leg Openings: Next row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Work a further 11 rows even in sc. Do not fasten off. Right Side is complete.
With RS facing, skip next 9 sc. Rejoin MC to rem sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 54 sc (Center Section). Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Work a further 11 rows even in sc. Fasten off. Center Section is complete.
With RS facing, skip next 9 sc. Rejoin MC to rem sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of last 12 sc (Left Side). Turn.
Work a further 11 rows even in sc. Fasten off. Left Side is complete.
Size S only: Joining row: Keeping cont of Chart I, with yarn from Right Side, proceed as follows: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across 5 sc (Right Side). Ch 4. Pat across 22 sc (Center Section). Ch 4. Pat across last 5 sc (Left Side). Turn. 40 sts. Place markers at each end of last row.
Next row: Ch 1. Keeping cont of chart, pat across all sts and ch. Turn.
Work 6 rows even from Chart. 24 rows of Chart I are now complete.
Sizes M and L only: Joining row: (RS). With MC yarn from Right Side, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first (8-12) sc (Right Side). Ch (7 -9). 1 sc in each of next (34-54) sc (Center Section). Ch (7 -9). 1 sc in each of last (8-12) sc (Left Side). Turn. (64-96) sts. Place markers at each end of last row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch to end of row. Turn.
All sizes: Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from markers (Joining Row) measures 4½ (7-10½)" [11.5 (18-26.5) cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Shape back: Next row: (RS). Skip first 7 (10-17) sc. Join MC with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 25 (43-61) sc. Turn. Leave rem 7 (10-17) sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 3 (5-5) times more. 18 (32-48) sts.
Cont even until work from 1st row after Neck Ribbing measures 10½ (16-22)" [26.5 (40.5-56) cm] (or desired length), ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Sew belly seam from Neck Ribbing to beg of back shaping.
Back Edging: With RS facing, MC and larger hook, join yarn with sl st at belly seam. Ch 1.
Work 1 row sc evenly around shaped back edge, working 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Leg Edging: With RS facing, MC and larger hook, join yarn with sl st in any st of Leg Opening. Ch 1. Work 1 row sc evenly around Leg Opening. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Leg Bands: With MC and smaller hook, ch 6 loosely.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loop only of each st, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 5 (6½-8)" [12.5 (16.5-20.5) cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off. Sew Leg Band seam. Sew Leg Band to Leg Edging.

instructions:
CUFF
Ch 15.
Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn – 14 sc.
Row 1: Ch 1, working in back loop only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat Row 1 until piece measures 18” from beginning, slightly stretched.
HAT
Turn cuff to work along long edge, sc 54 sts evenly spaced across, turn.
Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, *hdc in next 2 hdc, Fphdc in next st, hdc in 3 hdc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4-7: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 8:  (RS) Ch 2, *hdc in next 2 sts, Fphdc in next st, hdc in next hdc, hdc2tog; repeat from * across, turn – 45 sts.
Row 9: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 10: Ch 2, *hdc in next 2 sts, Fphdc in next st, hdc2tog; repeat from * across, turn – 36 sts.
Row 11: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 12: Ch 2, *hdc2tog, Fphdc in next st, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * across, turn – 27 sts.
Row 13: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 14: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc, *Fphdc in next st, hdc2tog; repeat from * to last 2 sts, Fphdc in next st, hdc in last st, turn – 19 sts.
Rows 15 and 17: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Rows 16 and 18: Ch 2, *hdc in next st, Fphdc in next st, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * across, turn.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew back seam, reversing sewing at Cuff so seam doesn’t show when Cuff is folded up to right side.
Weave in ends.

Tie: Holding 2 strands of yarn together, ch 30. Fasten off. Weave Tie under each Fphdc st 3 rows from last row. Pull tightly and knot to secure to make small gathering at top of Hat. Fold Cuff to right side.

instructions:
VEST
Back

Row 3: Ch 1, sc in 1st 2 sts, * ch 1, skip next st, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last st, sc in last st; turn.
Rows 4-11 (12, 13, 14): Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Shape Armholes
Row 12 (13, 14, 15): Slip st in 1st 2 sts, ch 1, work in established pattern across to last 2 sts; leave last 2 sts unworked; turn – 15 (17, 19, 20) sts.
Rows 13-16 (14-17, 15-18, 16-19): Ch 1, work in established pattern across; turn.
Rows 17-20 (18-22, 19-23, 20-25): Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Shape 1st Shoulder
Row 21 (23, 24, 26): Ch 1, sc in 1st 4 (4, 5, 5) sts; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 4 (4, 5, 5) sts.
Row 22 (24, 25, 27): Ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off.
Shape 2nd Shoulder
Row 21 (23, 24, 26): Working on same row as 1st Shoulder, skip next 7 (9, 9, 10) sts, join yarn in next st, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next 3 (3, 4, 4) sts; turn – 4 (4, 5, 5) sts.
Row 22 (24, 25, 27): Ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off.
Front
Work same as for Back through Row 17 (18, 19, 20).
Shape 1st Shoulder/Neck
Row 18 (19, 20, 21): Ch 1, sc in 1st 6 (7, 7, 8) sts; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 6 (7, 7, 8) sts.
Row 19 (20, 21, 22): Ch 1, sc2tog in first 2 sts, sc across; turn – 5 (6, 6, 7) sts.
Row 20 (21, 22, 23): Ch 1, sc across to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn – 4 (5, 5, 6) sts.
12 Month and 24 Month Size Only
Row 22 (24): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc across; turn – 4 (5) sts.
All Sizes
Rows 21-22 (23-24, 23-25, 25-27): Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Fasten off on last row.
Shape 2nd Shoulder/Neck
Row 18 (19, 20, 21): Working on same row as 1st Shoulder/Neck, skip next 3 (3, 5, 4) sts, join yarn in next st, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next 5, (6, 6, 7) sts; turn – 6 (7, 7, 8) sts.
Row 19 (20, 21, 22): Ch 1, sc across to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn – 5 (6, 6, 7) sts.
Row 20 (21, 22, 23): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc across; turn – 4 (5, 5, 6) sts.
12 Month and 24 Month Size Only
Row 22 (24): Ch 1, sc across to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn – 4 (5) sts.
All Sizes
Rows 21-22 (23-24, 23-25, 25-27): Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Fasten off on last row.
FINISHING
Slip st shoulders together. Slip st side seams. Weave in all ends.
Neck Edging
Join yarn in any st in Neck edge. Ch 1, sc evenly around neck, working sc2tog at each corner so Edging lays flat.
Armhole Edging
Join yarn in any st in Armhole edge. Work same as Neck Edging. Repeat for other Armhole.

abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.

gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 5: 1 each with A & F, B & F, C & F, D & F, and E & F)
With first color, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 5 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop
With right side facing, join F with slip st in any st, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in next 4 sts, turn, ch 8; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Chain (optional)
With F, ch 156 or to desired length. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

FINISHING 
With right sides facing, arrange squares as 
shown in Assembly Diagram. Join vertical 
edges first.
Joining Row: With right sides of first pair of

Round 2: Join A with sc in any st, sc in each

Round 1: With right side facing join yarn to marked dc on bottom edge of cape; ch 1, sc in same dc and next dc, 3 sc in last dc, 2 dc in next 19 row ends, 3 sc in next 6 row ends, 2 sc in next 20 row ends, 3 sc in next ch, [sc in each ch to next marker, 2 dc in marked ch] 3 times, sc in each ch to last ch, 3 sc in last ch, 2 sc in next 20 row ends, 3 sc in next 6 row ends, 2 sc in next 19 row ends, 3 sc in top of next dc, sc in each st across bottom edge of cape; join with a slip st to first sc – 360 sts.

Round 3 (Wrong Side): Slip st in next 3-ch space, ch 2, (2dc-cl, ch 3, 3dc-cl) in 3-ch space, * skip next ch-2 space, (3dc-cl, ch 3, 3dc-cl) in next 3-ch space; repeat from * to next corner, ([3dc-cl, ch 3] twice, 3 dc-cl) all in corner 5-ch space; repeat from * around; join to first 2dc-cl; turn – 132 dc-cl.

Special Abbreviations
dc2tog (worked over 2 sts) = [Yo and draw up a loop in next st, yo and draw through 2 loops] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
2dc-cl = [Yo and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] twice in space, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Edging

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 4 yds 495 Wood Violet
sewing or beading needle and matching thread
two silver seed beads (one for each earring)
four 6mm gray glass pearl beads (two for each earring)
two silver fishhook earring wires (one for each earring)
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: One earring measures ½” (12.7 mm) wide and 1½” (3 cm) long, not including earring wire.
gauge: One crocheted bead measures about 1/2” (12.7 mm) x 5/8” (15.9 mm). Use hook size needed to obtain finished size of bead. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FINISHING
For each earring: With sewing or beading needle and matching thread, string beads in the following order: seed bead (for anchor), pearl bead, crocheted bead, pearl bead, crocheted bead. Take care to thread crochet beads straight through center, to ensure that they do not hang crookedly. Sew earring wire to top of earring. Weave in any remaining ends.

SPECIAL STITCH
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

NOTES
1.Each earring is made from two crocheted beads that are separated by pearl beads.
2. Crocheted beads are worked in continuous rounds. Do not join and do not turn at the ends of rounds. A stitch marker can be used to indicate the end of rounds.
3. One end of each crocheted bead looks tidier than the other. Arrange beads accordingly.

CROCHETED BEADS  
(make 4 – 2 per earring)
Ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch around—6 sc. Place a marker (optional) in last stitch to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sts.
Stuff bead with a pinch of fiberfill. Use blunt end of crochet hook, or something similar, to tamp stuffing in place.
Round 7: Sc2tog, [skip next st, slip st in next st] twice.
Fasten off. Weave in ends. Trim stray ends of fiberfill, if needed.

pattern_name: Crochet Granny Square Bright Baby Blanket
materials: Bernat® All in One™ Blanket Granny™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 178 yds/163 m)
Contrast A Fruit Juice (65006) 1 ball or 3 Squares
Contrast B Throwback (65003) 1 ball or 3 Squares
Contrast C Seaside Shine (65005) 1 ball or 3 Squares
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: Motif = Approx 10½" [26.5 cm] square.
instructions:
BABY BLANKET
Motif (Make 3 each in A, B, and C).
Notes: 
• Motifs begin with Color 1 
(shortest section of color rep) 
from center of ball, leaving a 4" 
[10 cm] tail to weave in.
• All color changes occur at end 
of rnd where colors are spliced 
together, and should align with 
sl st at end of rnd..
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in 
the Motif with 5 colors in total. 
• If too much color is left at end of 
rnd, pull back some sts and 
slightly loosen gauge to re-work 
sts and finish at color change. 
• If too little color is left, pull back 
some sts and slightly tighten 
gauge to re-work sts and finish 
at color change.
• If splicing is visible on RS adjust 
sts so splice sits to WS, or work 
over splice on next rnd.
• At end of final rnd Motif should 
measure 10½" [26.5 cm] square. 
Cut yarn where Color 5 (longest 
section of color rep) ends, 
leaving approx 42" [106.5 cm] 
tail at end of Motif for joining. 
• Begin next Motif with Color 1 
and rep 5 rnds for each Motif.

With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to 
first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 
3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 
3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. 
Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from 
* twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 
sp. Join. 
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 
3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in 
next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) 
in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice 
more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. 
Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in next ch-3 
sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. 
*(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next 
ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in 
next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice 
more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc 
in first ch-3 sp. Join. 
Fasten off, leaving 42" [106.5 cm] 
tail.
Assembly
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). 
Following Assembly Diagram, 
using long tails and rem yarn in 
coordinating shade(s), sl st Motifs 
tog, working through back loops 
only and keeping working yarn to 
WS of work to create a flat sl st 
chain detail on RS of work (see 
diagram). 

Note: Keep working yarn to WS of 
work so only flat sl st chain is visible 
on RS.

abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc in indicated stitch. Drop loop from hook. Re-insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5-dc group. Pull dropped loop through stitch. Ch 1 to close popcorn.

instructions:
Notes: 
• DO NOT use these as hot pads.

Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
(See Diagrams on pages 3 and 4)
With A, ch 10. Sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. 31 dc in ring. Join. Fasten off A. 32 dc. 
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 7. Skip next 3 dc. *1 sc in next dc. Ch 7. Skip next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 ch-7 loops and 8 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 9 sc in each ch-7 loop around. Join. Fasten off B. 
4th rnd: Join C with sl st to 5th sc of 9-sc group. Ch 3. 8 dc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 2. Skip next 8 sc. 9 dc in next sc (5th sc of next 9-sc group). Rep from * around. Ch 2. Skip last 8 sc. Join. Fasten off C. 
5th rnd: Join D with sl st to first dc. Ch 1. 1 sc same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 dc. Popcorn in next ch-2 sp. *1 sc in each of next 9 dc. Popcorn in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off D. 
6th rnd: Join E with sl st to top of any popcorn. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 12. (1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch) - petal made. 1 sc in same sc where last sc of 6nd rnd was made. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *1 sc in next popcorn. Petal. 1 sc in same sc where last sc of 6nd rnd was made. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog over next sc and first ch of ch-12. Working up side of petal in rem loops of ch-12, 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch of ch-12. Working down side of petal, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 tr in each of next 2 tr. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Sc2tog over next sc of petal and next sc of 6th rnd. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog over next sc and hdc of petal, skipping sc2tog. Working up side of petal, 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 3 sc in next sc (top point). Working down side of petal, 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog over next hdc of petal and next sc of 7th rnd, skipping sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Contrast A Golden Haze (69024) 1 ball

Matching sewing thread and needle to sew in zipper.
abbreviations: Hdc3bl = Half double crochet through 3rd loop at back of work.
gauge: 20 sc and 22 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Bernat® Softee® Cotton. 28 sc and 30 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Aunt Lydia® Classic™ 10
instructions:
SIDE (make 2)
Note:  Sides are worked in a continuous spiral. Do not work ch at beg of rnd; simply work directly into next st (noting marker to indicate end of rnd moves up each rnd).
**With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.  See diagram on page 3.
Set-up:  (3 sc. 7 hdc) all in ring. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. Place marker in last hdc for end of rnd. 10 sts.
1st rnd:  2 hdc3bl in each hdc around. 20 hdc3bl.
2nd rnd:  *2 hdc3bl in next st. 1 hdc3bl in next st. Rep from * around. 30 hdc3bl.
3rd rnd:  *2 hdc3bl in next st. 1 hdc3bl in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 40 hdc3bl.
4th rnd:  *2 hdc3bl in next st. 1 hdc3bl in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 50 hdc3bl.
Cont as established, inc 10 sts every rnd until there are 130 sts. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.
Surface crochet: Join B with sl st to 1st st of spiral. *Insert hook from right to left, behind next st and pull up a loop. Pull loop through loop on hook. Rep from * around all sts in spiral. Fasten off at end of spiral.
GUSSET
With A, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Gusset, when slightly stretched, measures approx 25" [63.5 cm], ending on a RS row.
Do not fasten off at end of row.
Turn Gusset to work edging along side edge.
1st row: Ch 1. Work 130 sc evenly along side edge. Fasten off.
Join A with sl st and work 130 sc evenly across opposite side edge. Fasten off.
Sew foundation row and final row edges tog.
ATTACH GUSSET AND SIDES
First side: With WS of pieces tog, align sts of both Gusset and Side. (You may find it helpful to pin or clip pieces in position).
1st rnd: Join B with sl st to back loop of any Side st. Ch 1. Working through back loop of Side and front loop of Gusset AT SAME TIME, join Side and Gusset by working 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Second side:  Place markers 7" [18 cm] apart along second side for zipper opening. With WS tog, align sts of both Gusset and rem side.
1st row: Join B with sl st to first marked st. Ch 1. Work 2 sc in each sc to second marked st. Fasten off.
HANDLE
With A, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn. 1 sc in first sc. Place marker in last sc for end of rnd. Work 1 sc in each sc around until Handle measures 24" [61 cm].
Beg working in rows: 1st row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row.
FINISHING
With sewing thread and needle, sew zipper into top of Bag in zipper opening. Sew sides of Handle worked in rows to either side edge of Gusset.

Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit hip measurement: 4 yrs 23½" [59.5 cm], 6 yrs 25" [63.5 cm], 8 yrs 28" [71 cm]. Finished hip: 4 yrs 26" [66 cm], 6 yrs 28" [71 cm], 8 yrs 31" [78.5 cm]

instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
LEFT LEG
**Ch 54 ( 58-62).
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 52 ( 56-60) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 54 ( 58-62) hdc.
3rd to 5th (7th-7th) rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd to 5th ( 7th-7th) rows 7 ( 8-10) times more. 68 ( 74-82) hdc. Work even in hdc until work from beg measures 17 ( 19-21)" [43 ( 48.5-53.5) cm], ending on a WS row.**
Shape crotch: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of next 4 ( 5-6) sts. Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 8 ( 9-10) hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 56 ( 60-66) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 54 ( 58-64) sts.
3rd row: As 2nd row. 52 ( 56-62) sts.
Work even until work from 1st row of crotch shaping measures 4½ ( 5½-6½)" [11.5 ( 14-16.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape back: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in each of first 18 ( 19-21) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 17 ( 19-21) sts. 1 sc in each of last 17 ( 18-20) sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 ( 18-20) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 17 ( 19-21) sts. 1 dc in each of last 18 ( 19-21) sts. Fasten off.
RIGHT LEG
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Leg.
Shape crotch: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of next 6 ( 7-8) sts. Ch 1. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 6 ( 7-8) hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 56 ( 60-66) sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 54 ( 58-64) sts.
3rd row: As 2nd row. 52 ( 56-62) sts.
Work even until work from 1st row of crotch shaping measures 4½ ( 5½-6½)" [11.5 ( 14-16.5) cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape back: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 ( 18-20) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 17 ( 19-21) sts. 1 dc in each of last 18 ( 19-21) sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in each of next 18 ( 19-21) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 17 ( 19-21) sts. 1 sc in each of last 17 ( 18-20) sts. Fasten off.
Assemble Pants
Fold Left Leg in half with RS facing. Seam tog from base of crotch to base of hem. Rep for Right Leg. Turn Right Leg right-side-out, leave Left Leg inside-out.
Left Leg
WS facing out
Right Leg
RS facing out
Place Right Leg inside Left Leg, matching points marked with a blue “X” in diagram below. Seam crotch seam tog from center front to center back.
Waistband
With WS facing, join yarn with sl st on left side of center back seam.
1st rnd: Ch 2. Work 100 ( 108-116) hdc evenly around waist edge. Join with sl st to first st.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcbp around next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
FRONT BIB
Ch 32 ( 34-36).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 ( 32-34) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 28 ( 30-32) hdc.
4th to 8th rows: As 2nd row. Rep 3rd to 8th rows twice more. 24 ( 26-28) hdc. Rep 2nd row until Bib from beg measures 6 ( 7-8½)" [15 ( 18-22) cm]. Fasten off.
Front Bib Border
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner of Front Bib.
1st row: Ch 1. Work 24 ( 28-34) sc evenly up edge of Bib to top right corner. 3 sc in corner, PM on center sc. Work 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 ( 16-18) sts. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 3 sc in corner, PM on center sc. Work 24 ( 28-34) sc evenly down edge of Bib to bottom left corner. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to marked st. 3 sc in marked st. (1 sc in each sc to next ch-3 sp. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp) twice. 1 sc in each sc to marked st. 3 sc in marked st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
BACK BIB
Ch 22 ( 26-30).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 20 ( 24-28) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 3 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 18 ( 22-26) hdc.
3rd to 7th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd to 7th rows 3 times more. 12 ( 16-20) sts.
Rep 3rd row until Bib from beg measures 7½ ( 8-9½)" [19 ( 20.5-24) cm]. Fasten off.
Back Bib Border
With RS facing, join with sl st to bottom right corner of Back Bib.
1st row: Ch 1. Work 36 ( 40-48) sc evenly up edge of Bib to top right corner. 3 sc in corner. PM on center sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 ( 16-20). 3 sc in corner. PM on center sc. Work 36 ( 40-48) sc evenly down edge of Bib to bottom left corner. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each sc to marked st. 3 sc in marked st) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
STRAPS (make 2).
Ch 7 ( 9-11).
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 ( 8-10) sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Strap from beg measures 7 ( 8-9)" [18 ( 20.5-23) cm]. Fasten off.
Join Straps to either side of Top of Back Bib.
Back Bib
Join Front Bib and Back Bib to Pants, being careful to align center of Bibs over center front and center back of Pants.
Try on Overalls to mark button placement. Sew buttons with sewing thread to end of Straps to correspond to buttonholes.

Special Stitch
InV-st (Inverted V-Stitch) (worked over 3 
stitches) = Yarn over, insert hook into indicated 
stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, yarn over 
and draw through 2 loops (2 loops on hook), 
skip next stitch, yarn over, insert hook into 
next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop (4 
loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 
loops (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw 
through all 3 loops.

1. Pillow cover is one piece worked back and
forth in rows. Cover is folded and sewn on

polyester fiberfill.

instructions:
Notes:
• Cardigan is comprised of 2 Hexagons which are folded and seamed along the top to form Sleeves and seamed down Center Back.
• Hexagon shape will become wavy as you progress and will not lay flat as it begins to grow. Do not worry if your piece does not lay flat before folding! Trust the process!
• Join 2nd ball of yarn, matching color from previous ball, letting colors change gradually.
• Excess of yarn, left from matching new balls, can be used for Hood.

HEXAGON (make 2)
See diagram on page 5.
With A, chain (ch) 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form ring.
1st round (rnd): Ch 5 [counts as double crochet (dc) and ch-2 at start of this rnd and next rnds]. (3 dc. Ch 2) 5 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5. 6 groups of 3 dc and 6 ch-2 spaces (sps).

2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Repeat (Rep) from * 4 times more. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join B with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5. Do not break A.

3rd rnd: With B, sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip last 3 dc. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.

4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) twice. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) twice. Skip last 3 dc. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join A with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.

First 4 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.

5th rnd: With A, sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. [*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 5 times. Rep from * to * to end of rnd. Skip last 3 dc. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.

NOTE: Your work will not lay flat at this point, don’t worry! It’s part of the process! 
Keeping continuity (cont) of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until work from center to straight side of Hexagon measures approximately (approx) 10½ ( 12-14½ -16½ ) cm. Fasten off.

FINISHING before Hood
Following Diagram, bring opposite points of Left Side Hexagon together and fold to form Left Side of Cardigan. Rep for Right Side Hexagon. Place marker between 3-dc groups along top edge 4 ( 4-5-5) groups of 3-dc from front edge. Sew center back seam. Sew top sleeve seams to markers. Sew back seam.

HOOD
See diagrams on page 6.
With RS facing, join corresponding color to keep cont of Stripe Pat with sl st to corner ch-2 sp of front lapel of Right Front. 
Cont in Stripe Pat and proceed as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to last 3 dc before right shoulder seam. 3 dc in sp of shoulder seam. Rep from * to * to last 3 dc before Back seam. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp of Back seam. Rep from * to * to last 3 dc before left shoulder seam. 3 dc in sp of shoulder seam. Rep from * to * to last 3-dc group before corner of left side lapel. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in corner ch-2 sp. Turn. 17 ( 17-19-19) 3-dc groups.

2nd row: [Increase (Inc) row]. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 8 ( 8-9-9) times. Skip next dc. Ch 1. 1 dc (center dc) in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next dc. (3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc Skip next 3 dc) 8 ( 8-9-9) times. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to ch-1 sp before center dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. Skip next (center) dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 18 ( 18-20-20) groups of 3-dc.

4th row: (Inc row). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to center back ch-3 sp. [3 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc (center dc). Ch 1. 3 dc] in center back ch-3 sp. Rep from * to * to last 3 dc. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to ch-1 sp before center dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next (center) dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 20 ( 20-22-22) groups of 3-dc.

6th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 

7th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 9 ( 9-10-10) times. Ch 3 (center back). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

8th to 13th rows: Rep 4th to 7th rows once more, then 4th and 5th rows once, having 1 more 3-dc group before center. 24 ( 24-26-26) groups of 3-dc at end of last rep.

14th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

15th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 14th and 15th rows until Hood measures approx 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a RS row. 

Shape top of Hood: See diagram on page 6.
1st row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 10 ( 10-11-11) times. Skip next 2 groups of 3-dc. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 9 times. Skip next 2 groups of 3-dc. *3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. 
Fasten off, leaving a yarn tail 20" [51 cm] long for seaming. Fold top of Hood in half. Using yarn tail, sew Hood seam, being sure to keep edges flat.

SLEEVE CUFFS
See diagram on page 5.
With RS facing, join corresponding color to keep cont of Stripe Pat with sl st in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc (in last sp between 2 groups of 3-dc before shoulder seam) on last row at bottom of Sleeve.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as sl st. * Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

Rep last rnd until Sleeve from underarm measures 17" [43 cm]. Fasten off.

Rep for 2nd Sleeve.

BOTTOM HEM
See diagram on page 5.
With RS facing, join corresponding color to keep cont of Stripe Pat with sl st in corner ch-2 sp at bottom of Left Front. 
1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same ch-2 sp as sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * along bottom edge to ch-2 corner sp at bottom right front, taking note that at center back seam, 3 dc in last ch-2 sp of left side. 3 dc in next ch-2 corner sp of right side. 3 dc in bottom right front ch-2 corner sp. Turn.

2nd row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

3rd row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ch-1 sp. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Turn.

4th and 5th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows.

Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Light: 1 (1, 2, 2) ball(s) 3303 Shell A and 1 ball 3012 Ink B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 14 hdc = 4" (10 cm); 9 rows = 4" (10 cm) with smaller hook; 5 shells = 4" (10 cm); 10 rows = 4" (10 cm) with larger hook.
instructions:
Yoke
With smaller hook and A, ch 63 (67, 71, 75)
Row 1 [right (wrong, right, right) side]: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning skipped ch do not count as a st) and in each remaining ch across, turn—61 (65, 69, 73) hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, hdc in first st, *ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—31 (33, 35, 37) hdc and 30 (32, 34, 36) ch-2 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, hdc in first st, *2 hdc in next ch-2 space, hdc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—91 (97, 103, 109) hdc. 
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, hdc in first 1 (1, 3, 4) st(s), *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 17 (31, 19, 20) sts; repeat from * across, turn—96 (100, 108, 114) hdc.
Row 7: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 11 (9, 26, 18) sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 11 (9, 26, 18) sts; repeat from * across, turn—104 (110, 112, 120) hdc.
Size 6 months only:
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 12 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 12 sts; repeat from * across; change to B, turn—112 (110, 119, 126) hdc.
Size 12 months only:
Row 8: Ch 1, hdc in each st across, turn—110 hdc.
Row 9: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 10 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 10 sts; repeat from * across; change to B, turn—120 hdc.
Size 18 months only:
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 15 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 15 sts; repeat from * across, turn—119 hdc.
Row 9: Ch 1, hdc in first 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 12 sts; repeat from * across, turn—128 hdc.
Row 10: Ch 1, hdc in each st across; change to B, turn.
Size 24 months only:
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 19 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 19 sts; repeat from * across, turn—126 hdc.
Row 9: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 20 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 20 sts; repeat from * across, turn—132 hdc.
Row 10: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 32 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 32 sts; repeat from * across; change to B, turn—136 hdc.
Bodice
Note: To minimize weaving in ends, carry color not in use on wrong side until next needed.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; change to A; join with slip st in first sc—112 (120, 128, 136) sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first 15 (16, 17, 18) sts, ch 2, skip next 26 (28, 30, 32) sts (first armhole made), sc in next 30 (32, 34, 36) sts, ch 2, skip next 26 (28, 30, 32) sts (second armhole made), sc in last 15 (16, 17, 18) sts; change to B; join with slip st in first sc—60 (64, 68, 72) sc and 2 armholes.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; change to A; join with slip st in first sc—60 (64, 68, 72) sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; change to B; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 5: Repeat Round 3.
Round 6: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Do not fasten off. Turn work to wrong side and change to larger hook.
Skirt
Round 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, shell in first st, *skip next st, shell in next st; repeat from * around, skip last st—30 (32, 34, 36) shells. Do not join rounds until instructed. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Shell in sc of each shell around. Repeat Round 2 until skirt measures 6 (6½, 7½, 8½)" [15 (16.5, 19, 21.5) cm] from bottom of bodice; join with slip st in sc of first shell at end of last round. Fasten off.
Hem Edging
Round 1: With wrong side facing, join B with sc in same sc as join, 2 dc in same st, shell in sc of each shell around. 
Round 2: Shell in sc of each shell around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Neckline Edging
Row 1: With right side of yoke facing, join A with sc in end of first row of left back above bodice; working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced across to last row, (sc, ch 5, sc) in last row (buttonhole made); working in opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch around to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows of right back, skip first row, sc evenly spaced across. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Neckline Trim
With B, ch 100 or as many ch as needed to fit around Row 2 of yoke, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off. 
Beginning at edge of Row 2, skipping as many sts as desired, evenly weave trim over and under sts. Distribute trim evenly and tack edges to neckline edging. 
Bow
With B, ch 41, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off. Shape into a bow and tack at center to hold in place. Referring to photograph, sew to neckline trim or where desired.
Sew button to 3-sc group of neckline edging.
Weave in ends.

instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Crochet a cheerful bag for the bottle of cheer you bring for hostess and friend! For other seasons of the year, simply change the colors for a year-round gift-giving idea.
Rounds 12-29: Repeat Rounds 10 and 11.
Round 30: Repeat Round 10, but do not change color. Continue with A only.
Eyelet Round 31: With A, ch 4, skip first 2 sts, * dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn.

BAG
Round 1: With A, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds. Place marker in first sc and move up each round.

Round 3: [Sc in next sc, inc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, inc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, inc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 8: Sc in back loop of each sc around; remove marker and join to first sc; TURN.
Round 9: Ch 1, dec, sc in next 19 sc, dec, sc in last 19 sc; join; turn – 40 sc.
Round 10: Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next st and each st around changing to B in last st; join with a slip st in top of ch-3; turn. Carry unused color inside bag as you go.
Round 11: Ch 1, slip st in slip st, dc in next dc, * slip st in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, changing to A in last dc; join with slip st to first slip st; turn.

materials: RED HEART ® 'Super Saver ® ', Art. E300, 100% Acrylic (6 ounce/348 yard multi color skein): 5 Ounces No. 310 Monet CA.
RED HEART ® Ltd. 'Foxy™ ', Art. E724, 100% Polyester (1.76 ounce/89 yard ball): 1 Ball No. 9379 Plummy CB.
Yarn needle; one 5/8" button; sewing needle and thread.
abbreviations: CA, CB = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 13 sts = 4"; 17 rows = 4" in sc rows. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PONCHO: With CA, ch 38.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * hdc in next ch, 3 dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch; rep from * across; turn.
Now work in BACK LPS only unless otherwise directed.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; 3 sc in next st – inc made; * sc in next 5 sts, inc; rep from * to last 3 sts; sc in last 3 sts; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 3 sc, * inc, sc in next 2 sc; draw up a lp in next sc, skip next sc, draw up a lp in next sc, yo and draw through all 3 lps on hook – dec made; sc in next 2 sc **; rep from * to last 2 sc, end at **; skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, * inc **, sc in next 7 sc; rep from * to last 4 sc, end at **; sc in last 4 sc; turn.
Rows 5 and 6: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 4 sc, * inc, sc in next 3 sc **, dec, sc in next 3 sc; rep from * to last 2 sc, end at **; skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, * inc **, sc in next 9 sc; rep from * to last 5 sc, end at **; sc in last 5 sc; JOIN with a sl st in FRONT LP of first sc of this row; TURN.
Now work in rounds, continuing to work in back lps unless otherwise directed.
Rnds 8, 9 and 10: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 5 sc, * inc, sc in next 4 sc **, dec, sc in next 4 sc; rep from * to last 2 sc, end at **; skip next sc, sc in last sc; join in front lp of first sc; turn.
Rnd 11: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, * inc **, sc in next 11 sc; rep from * to last 6 sc, end at **; sc in last 6 sc; join in front lp; turn.
Rnds 12, 13, and 14: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 6 sc, * inc, sc in next 5 sc **, dec, sc in next 5 sc; rep from * to last 2 sc, end at **; skip next sc, sc in last sc; join to front lp; turn.
Rnd 15: Ch 3, 2 dc in first sc, * skip next 2 sc, sc in next 4 sc, inc, sc in next 4 sc, skip next 2 sc **, 5 dc in next sc; rep from * to last st, end at **; 3 dc in last st; skip beg ch-3, join with a sl st in front lp of next dc; turn.
Rnd 16: Ch 1, 2 sc in first dc, * sc in next 2 sts, dec, sc in next 2 sts **, inc; rep from * around; sc in same st as first 2 sc of this rnd; join in front lp of first sc; turn.
Rnds 17-22: Ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining, * sc in next 2 sc, dec, sc in next 2 sc **, inc; rep from * around, end at **; sc in same st as first 2 sc; join in front lp; turn.
Rnd 23: Ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining, * sc in next 7 sc **, inc; rep from * around, end at **; sc in same sc as first 2 sc; join in front lp changing to CB; turn.
Rnd 24: With CB, ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining, * sc in next 3 sc, dec, sc in next 3 sc **, inc; rep from * around, end at **; sc in same sc as first 2 sc; join in both lps of first sc; do NOT turn.
Rnd 25-Work all in BOTH lps: Ch 1, inc in first sc, * sc in next 3 sc, dec, sc in next 3 sc **, inc; rep from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off.
HOOD: Beg at face edge with CA, ch 56. Work all sts in both lps.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 55 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Rep Row 2.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, skip next sc, sc in each sc to last 2 sc; skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 53 sc.
Rep Rows 3-5 three more times – 47 sc. Work even in sc until 4" from beg.
Shape Crown: Ch 1, sc in first 22 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in last 22 sc; turn – 45 sc. Work 1 row even. Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first 21 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in last 21 sc; turn – 43 sc.
Shape Back: Sl st in first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in next 37 sc; turn. Next Row: Sl st in first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in next 14 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next 14 sc; turn – 29 sc. Next Row: Sl st in first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in next 23 sc; turn. Next Row: Sl st in first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in next 7 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next 7 sc – 15 sc. Fasten off.
Sew back seam. Sew hood to neck edge. Edging: With right side facing, attach CA at seam at left neck edge; ch 1, work sc evenly down left opening and up right opening to seam; ch 9 for button loop; sl st in same place as last sc. Fasten off.
Hood Edging: With right side facing, attach CB at seam at right neck edge; ch 1, sc in each st of beg ch of hood; turn. Work 1 more row sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Sew button to left neck edge.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Contrast A Ever After Pink (86020)     1    1  ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: 13 hdc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Hat is worked from face opening to back of head.
Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc throughout.
HAT
With smaller hook and MC, ch 8. 
Ribbing: 1st row:  (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc. 
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row (buttonhole row): Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
5th row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 17 (18)" [43 (45.5) cm], when slightly stretched, ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. 
Place marker on side edge of Ribbing 5 (5½)" [12.5 (14) cm] up from foundation ch. 
1st row:  (RS). Working across side edge of Ribbing, ch 1. Work 42 (48) sc to marker. Turn. 
Change to larger hook. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg (including ribbing) measures 4 (5)" [11.5 (12.5) cm], ending on a WS row. PM at end of last row.
Dec as follows: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 (6) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 36 (42) hdc. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 (5) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 30 (36) hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 3 (4) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 24 (30) hdc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 (3) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 18 (24) hdc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 1 (2) hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 12 (18) hdc. Turn.
Size 18/24 mos only: 6th row:  Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 12 hdc. Turn.
Both sizes: Next row:  Ch 2. *Hdc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 6 hdc.
Fasten off leaving a long end.  
Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely. Sew back seam to marked row.
Outer Ear (make 2)
With larger hook and MC, ch 3. 
1st row: (RS). 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 4½ (5½)" [11.5 (14) cm], ending on a WS row. 
Fasten off.
Inner Ear (make 2)

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 311 White A, 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red B and 385 Royal C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8] and 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 17 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Heart pattern stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PILLOW COVER
With A, ch 120, leaving a long tail for sewing seam closed, slip st in first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist sts. Place marker for beginning of round. Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around – 120 sc. Round 2: [Sc in next sc, sc in back loop only of next sc] around. Round 3: [Sc in back loop only of next sc, sc in next sc] around. Repeat Rounds 2-3 until piece measures 17" [43 cm], tugging from side to side to settle sts before measuring, slip st in first st on last round to join. Fasten off. 
HEART
Row 1 (Right Side): With B, ch 4 (skipped 3 ch count as first dc), work 4 dc in 4th ch from hook – 5 dc. Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last 2 sc – 6 sc. Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in same st as ch 3, dc in each st to last st, 2 dc in last st – 8 dc. Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 3 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in last 3 sts – 10 sc. Fasten off. Row 5: With right side facing, join A in first sc with slip st, repeat Row 3 – 12 dc. Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 5 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in last 5 sts – 14 sc. Row 7: Repeat Row 3 – 16 dc. Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Fasten off. Row 9: With right side facing, join B in first sc with a slip st, repeat Row 3 – 18 dc. Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 8 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in last 8 sts – 20 sc. Row 11: Repeat Row 3 – 22 dc. Row 12: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st – 26 sc. Fasten off. Row 13: With right side facing, join A in first sc with a slip st, repeat Row 3 – 28 dc. Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 15: Repeat Row 3 – 30 dc. Row 16: Repeat Row 14. Fasten off. Row 17: With right side facing, join B in first sc with a slip st, repeat Row 3 – 32 dc. Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] twice – 36 sc. Row 19: Repeat Row 3 – 38 dc. Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 34 sts, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last st – 40 sc. Fasten off. Rows 21-24: Repeat Rows 13-16 – 44 sc on last row worked. Rows 25-27: With B, repeat Rows 13-15 – 48 dc on last row worked. Row 28: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st] 4 times, sc in last 2 sts – 53 sc. Fasten off. Row 29: With right side facing, join C in first st with a slip st, ch 3, dc in each st across – 53 dc. Row 30: Repeat Row 14. Row 31: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 25 sts, ch 2, slip st in next st, ch 2, dc in each st to end – 52 dc and 2 ch-2 spaces.
First Heart Side
Row 32: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 23 sts, sc2tog over last dc and ch-2 space, leave remaining sts unworked – 25 sc. Row 33: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across – 25 dc. Row 34: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts, sc2tog – 22 sc. Row 35: Repeat Row 33. Row 36: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 18 sts, sc2tog – 20 sc. Row 37: Repeat Row 33. Row 38: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, [sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog] twice – 17 sc. Row 39: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr in next 10 sts, dc in next st, hdc in next st, ch 1, skip next st, slip st in last st – 2 hdc, 2 dc, and 10 tr. Fasten off.
Second Heart Side
Row 32: With wrong side facing and working across unworked sts, join C in unworked ch-2 space of Row 33 with a slip st, ch 1, sc2tog over ch-2 space and first dc, sc in next 23 sts, sc2tog – 25 sc. Rows 33-39: Repeat Rows 33-39 as for First Heart Side.
Edging
With right side facing, join B in top edge of top red stripe with a slip st, sc evenly spaced around all red and white edges, change to C, sc evenly around blue edge, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off.
Star (make 6)
With A, make an adjustable loop ring, leaving long end for sewing, [ch 2, dc, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, ch 2, slip st in slip ring] 5 times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Flatten Cover and sew one end closed. Insert pillow form. Sew opposite end closed. Sew stars in blue sections of Heart. Sew Heart in center of Pillow Cover. Weave in ends.
